channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed

item.title: Skyfire lets AI agents spend your money
item.description: There’s a lot of hype about the promise of AI agents today, but payments are a huge limiting factor. Today, an AI agent might be able to plan a vacation for you independently, but a human has to step in when it’s time to input your credit card information. Skyfire Systems wants to change that. item.title: WeTransfer’s expiry dates haven’t gone away, but you can at least extend them
item.description: WeTransfer’s expiry dates have been a major paint-point for users — especially creatives. Thing is, if you don’t download the files the moment you get the link or email you can easily forget to do so before the link expires. At which point you’ll have to ask for it to be resent. item.title: The banks that loaned Musk $13B to buy Twitter might be having regrets
item.description: X, formerly known as Twitter, looks like a pretty bad investment right about now.
